data.event: Windsor's first European settlers arrived in 1851.

event.title: 1855, Hiram Lewis, a Pony Express rider, became

data.event: In 1855, Hiram Lewis, a Pony Express rider, became the town's first postmaster.
In 1855, a post office was established in Windsor.

event.title: The following year, a business enterprise was built

data.event: The following year, a business enterprise was built in eastern Windsor, which included a goods store, a shoe shop, a grocery and meat market, a saloon, a hotel, a boarding house, and two confectionery shops.

event.title: was completed in the town in 1872

data.event: A railroad was completed in the town in 1872.
